blog.name: i-crossed-the-narrow-sea
blog.title: Valar Morghulis
blog.description: I'm here mostly for Arya x Jaqen or Jaqarya, if you prefer, amazing fanfiction authors whose stories help me to deal with the damage the showmakers did to Arya and Jaqen storyline, especially Braavos part. Obsessed with Jaqen H'ghar and Arya Stark and the House of Black and White ;) I love Braavos above all and I hope Arya and Jaqen story will be much better in the next book than what we've got so far in the show. I also love Tyrion  Lannister (really hope he'll get better lines next season), Jon Snow and ser Bronn of the Blackwater. I ship Arya and Jaqen, Tyrion and Tysha (I believe there is hope for them in the book) , Jaime and Brienne, Sansa and Sandor though I also like the idea of Sansa reuniting with Tyrion. I believe Rhaegar Targaryen never raped  Lyanna Stark but saved her from awful Robert Baratheon.

summary: 17 Most Shocking Emmys Snubs and Surprises: Bill Maher, Bill Hader, Roseanne & More
title: 17 Most Shocking Emmys Snubs and Surprises: Bill Maher, Bill Hader, Roseanne & More
body:
Winter is back, but Selina Meyer is on a leave of absence, thus clarifying most of the shake-ups in this year’s Emmy nominations.

With 22 nominations, Game of Thrones em> is back with a vengeance, resulting all shows with “the worlds largest” nods, scarcely rimming out Saturday Night Live and Westworld ‘s 21 each and the 20 paid attention to The Handmaid’s Tale .( Blessed be the fruit, too. Imagine the thinkpiece overload if that woefully uneven season of Westworld had scored the most nominations .)

Veep sitting out the slapstick back built chamber for freshman slapsticks The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel and Barry to score massive Emmy tallies, with Mrs. Maisel ‘ s 14 nods and Barry ‘ s 13 falling merely under Atlanta ‘s comedy-leading 16 -nomination total.

Also scoring large-hearted: The Assassination of Gianni Versace: American Crime Story ( 18 ), The Crown ( 13 ), and Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert ( 13 ). Not scoring large-hearted? For our money, the five better TV is demonstrated that aired last year: The Good Fight , Killing Eve , The Good Place , One Day at a Time , and American Vandal , all of which failed to pick up series nods in their respective categories.

That means that this year’s noms moved just about as expected, which is to say, they’re exclusively nonsensical. The best depicts and performances on tv, as usual, go overlooked because of Emmy voters’ utterly random savours. The large-scale series from last year all recite again this year, with enjoy shown to just a handful of new serial. Things search diverse-ish. Broadcast is still almost completely shunned.( How else to explain the enjoy for the Curb Your Enthusiasm reboot over the far superior Will& Grace reboot ?)

There’s a lot to cheer about. A plenty to complain about. It’s pretty much business as usual. So let’s go about our usual business: laying out this year’s biggest snubs and amazes.( Encounter the full list of nominees here .)

SURPRISE: John Legend! Ricky Martin! Sara Bareilles ! strong>

It’s a good year to be a singing actor. John Legend, Sara Bareilles, and Brandon Victor Dixon all scored acting nominations for their entirely sing is currently working on NBC’s Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert , differentiating the first time performers from one of the networks’ live musicals have scored Emmy gestures. And Ricky Martin didn’t sing a word but still got a gesture for his heartbreaking turning as Gianni Versace’s lover on American Crime Story . em>

SNUB: Twin Peaks

Did that whole exhausting” is the Twin Peaks revival a Tv present or a movie ?” debate get to Emmy voters? Or did they are only not vex to watch? Either path, David Lynch’s Showtime reboot failed to score a Limited Series nod or mentions for performers Kyle MacLachlan and Laura Dern. Lynch did, nonetheless, get writing and directing noms, and the serial given nine total. That’s not too bad!

SURPRISE/ SNUB: Sandra Oh and Killing Eve

Our most piercing howl this morning was born out of the glee in watching Sandra Oh’s identify appear in the Best Drama Actress category. Rivaling “its been” Phoebe Waller-Bridge’s prestigious nomination for writing the serial. That’s great, but the serial itself more than deserved a Best Drama mention, and Oh’s co-star Jodie Comer should’ve been nominated alongside her in Best Actress. In reality, if we had an Emmy ballot, both Comer and the serial would get our referendums to win.

SURPRISE: Emmys truly, truly love Bill Hader

Bill Hader scored nominations for are active in, writing, aiming, and co-creating Barry , plus he earned a guest behaving nod for hosting Saturday Night Live . em> And Hader’s Barry co-creator Alec Berg is nominated for co-writing an occurrence of both that indicate and another HBO comedy , Silicon Valley , essentially vying against himself.

SNUB: Revivals…except Curb Your Enthusiasm

Networks may be revival crazy, but the Emmys sure aren’t. While Curb Your Enthusiasm picked up expected big gestures in Best Comedy and Best Actor, Will& Grace ‘ s–which we’re already on record liking a whole lot more than Curb ‘ s reboot–only major nominations were Megan Mullally’s supporting actress and Molly Shannon’s guest actress mentions. Good-for-nothing for the remainder of the Emmy-winning cast or Best Comedy. Twin Peaks didn’t fare much better, but both trumped Arrested Development , which came up completely empty.

SNUB/ SURPRISE: Speaking of improvements … Roseanne

The most talked-about reveal on Tv this past time didn’t carry polemic into a Best Comedy gesture, which is both unsurprising and maybe also totally scandalizing, depending on how cynical you are. Roseanne Barr didn’t take the whole ship down with her, though. Laurie Metcalf is nominated for Best Substantiating Actress–much deserved–though we’d have loved John Goodman and Sara Gilbert to have gotten more serious consideration, too.

SURPRISE: Jason Bateman dominates drama , not comedy

In the wake of the one of the most egregious mansplaining calamities recorded for public uptake, Jason Bateman’s joins Arrested Development ‘ s complete Emmy shut out. But we’d enterprise he’s hardly disturbed, what with receiving Best Drama Actor and Best Drama Directing nominations for his work on Netflix’s Ozark . Noted dramatic performer, Jason Bateman.

SURPRISE/ SNUB: Jessica Biel! And the utter nonsense of the Limited Series categories

Ladies and gentlemen, Emmy nominee Jessica Biel! Truthfully, the snark is totally unfounded, for Biel’s work on The Sinner is one of the only performances that belongs in the otherwise entirely random Best Limited Series or Movie Actress category, amid total nonsense rosters for the entire genre.

Good the job is rewarded–Laura Dern and The Tale , Benedict Cumberbatch and Patrick Melrose , Jesse Plemons and Black Mirror — but the rest is a grab bag. The Assassination of Gianni Versace deserve to be rained with adore, but we’d have limited the acting nods to Darren Criss, Judith Light, and Penelope Cruz. But the odd quantity of love for The Alienist , Genius: Picasso , and American Horror Story: Cult is laughable when Alias Grace , Howard’s End , and American Vandal em> all could have been nominated instead.

SNUB : Real Day With Bill Maher

Last year, Bill Maher’s HBO talk series payed a nomination despite a overflow of bad press over his use of the N-word. So it’s a little shocking to discover him passed over this year, after being nominated in Outstanding Variety Series every year from 2005 through 2014 and Outstanding Variety Talk Series in 2016 and 2017.

SURPRISE: Kenan Thompson, eventually ! strong>

After 15 years on Saturday Night Live , a long time tenure of any current casting member, Kenan Thompson gets his much overdue first Emmy acting nomination, joining last year’s nominees Alec Baldwin, Kate McKinnon, and Leslie Jones, and, in another delightful amaze, Aidy Bryant, too, who also scored her much deserved first acting gesture.( Fun fact: Both Thompson and Bryant have been nominated for one Emmy each before, for writing original anthems for SNL .)

SNUB: Jon Snow and Aunt Khaleesi

While Game of Thrones predominated the nominations, including behaving nods for Lena Headey, Peter Dinklage, and first-time nominee Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, both Kit Harington and Emilia Clarke were snubbed after moving up into the Lead Actor and Actress races. They shouldn’t feel too bad. Freddie Highmore, Liev Schrieber, J.K. Simmons, Jonathan Groff, Christine Baranski, Jodie Comer, Mandy Moore, and Claire Danes all failed to crack the stacked categories, too.

SURPRISE: Emmy nominee Fuller House

Once mocked as maybe the worst see on television and the case study for why reboot culture is bad for art and recreation, Fuller House is now an Emmy nominee, something its predecessor never managed to accomplish. It’s nod is in Outstanding Children’s Program, where it joins another amaze program, Netflix’s A Series of Unfortunate Events , which we are really adore and are very happy to see there.

SNUB: Transparent

It was a foregone conclusion that Jeffrey Tambor’s formerly award-winning performance wouldn’t repeat with a nomination this year after his controversy-mired firing from the Amazon series over allegations regarding sex misbehavior. But it is a bit of a surprise to see the former Emmy darling snubbed entirely this year. The directing, write, and concerts from Judith Light, Amy Landecker, and Gaby Hoffman are perennially award-worthy.

SURPRISE : GLOW

The Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling muscled their way into a competitive Outstanding Comedy Series category, which had to expand to eight nominees to accommodate all the programs. While it’s a bummer to see its stalwart commander Alison Brie come short for a Best Actress nod, her excellent co-star Betty Gilpin is a surprise nominee in the corroborating category.

HUH ?: Viola Davis

We’ll never question any awarding inclusion for the inimitable Viola Davis. But it’s still a trip-up to verify her nominated in the Guest Acting category for playing her How to Get Away With Murder character…on an occurrence of Scandal . em>

YAY !: Comedians ! strong>

Some of our favorite comics scored major nods. Amy Sedaris, Sarah Silverman, and Tracey Ullman are all vying in Variety Sketch Series for their respective testifies, agains t Drunk History and Portlandia . And John Mulaney, Michelle Wolf, and Patton Oswalt are all nominated for writing their own comedy specials.

WHOA: The Crown em> and The Handmaid’s Tale behaving bonanza

The behaving on The Crown and on The Handmaid’s Tale is real good. We love the actors on those testifies. The Emmys actually, genuinely love the actors on those depicts. In addition to dynamo Claire Foy and Elisabeth Moss getting their big gestures, nearly their entire supporting and guest casts join them. Matt Smith, Vanessa Kirby, and Matthew Goode are all nominated for The Crown . em> Meanwhile, Joseph Fiennes, Ann Dowd, Alexis Bledel, Yvonne Strahovski, Samira Wiley, Cherry Jones, and Kelly Jenrette are all nominated for The Handmaid’s Tale . em>

YAY !: Comedians ! strong>

And John Mulaney, Michelle Wolf, and Patton Oswalt are all nominated for writing their own comedy specials.

trail.content:
Winter is back, but Selina Meyer is on a leave of absence, thus clarifying most of the shake-ups in this year’s Emmy nominations.

With 22 nominations, Game of Thrones em> is back with a vengeance, resulting all shows with “the worlds largest” nods, scarcely rimming out Saturday Night Live and Westworld ‘s 21 each and the 20 paid attention to The Handmaid’s Tale .( Blessed be the fruit, too. Imagine the thinkpiece overload if that woefully uneven season of Westworld had scored the most nominations .)

Veep sitting out the slapstick back built chamber for freshman slapsticks The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel and Barry to score massive Emmy tallies, with Mrs. Maisel ‘ s 14 nods and Barry ‘ s 13 falling merely under Atlanta ‘s comedy-leading 16 -nomination total.

Also scoring large-hearted: The Assassination of Gianni Versace: American Crime Story ( 18 ), The Crown ( 13 ), and Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert ( 13 ). Not scoring large-hearted? For our money, the five better TV is demonstrated that aired last year: The Good Fight , Killing Eve , The Good Place , One Day at a Time , and American Vandal , all of which failed to pick up series nods in their respective categories.

That means that this year’s noms moved just about as expected, which is to say, they’re exclusively nonsensical. The best depicts and performances on tv, as usual, go overlooked because of Emmy voters’ utterly random savours. The large-scale series from last year all recite again this year, with enjoy shown to just a handful of new serial. Things search diverse-ish. Broadcast is still almost completely shunned.( How else to explain the enjoy for the Curb Your Enthusiasm reboot over the far superior Will& Grace reboot ?)

There’s a lot to cheer about. A plenty to complain about. It’s pretty much business as usual. So let’s go about our usual business: laying out this year’s biggest snubs and amazes.( Encounter the full list of nominees here .)

SURPRISE: John Legend! Ricky Martin! Sara Bareilles ! strong>

It’s a good year to be a singing actor. John Legend, Sara Bareilles, and Brandon Victor Dixon all scored acting nominations for their entirely sing is currently working on NBC’s Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert , differentiating the first time performers from one of the networks’ live musicals have scored Emmy gestures. And Ricky Martin didn’t sing a word but still got a gesture for his heartbreaking turning as Gianni Versace’s lover on American Crime Story . em>

SNUB: Twin Peaks

Did that whole exhausting” is the Twin Peaks revival a Tv present or a movie ?” debate get to Emmy voters? Or did they are only not vex to watch? Either path, David Lynch’s Showtime reboot failed to score a Limited Series nod or mentions for performers Kyle MacLachlan and Laura Dern. Lynch did, nonetheless, get writing and directing noms, and the serial given nine total. That’s not too bad!

SURPRISE/ SNUB: Sandra Oh and Killing Eve

Our most piercing howl this morning was born out of the glee in watching Sandra Oh’s identify appear in the Best Drama Actress category. Rivaling “its been” Phoebe Waller-Bridge’s prestigious nomination for writing the serial. That’s great, but the serial itself more than deserved a Best Drama mention, and Oh’s co-star Jodie Comer should’ve been nominated alongside her in Best Actress. In reality, if we had an Emmy ballot, both Comer and the serial would get our referendums to win.

SURPRISE: Emmys truly, truly love Bill Hader

Bill Hader scored nominations for are active in, writing, aiming, and co-creating Barry , plus he earned a guest behaving nod for hosting Saturday Night Live . em> And Hader’s Barry co-creator Alec Berg is nominated for co-writing an occurrence of both that indicate and another HBO comedy , Silicon Valley , essentially vying against himself.

SNUB: Revivals…except Curb Your Enthusiasm

Networks may be revival crazy, but the Emmys sure aren’t. While Curb Your Enthusiasm picked up expected big gestures in Best Comedy and Best Actor, Will& Grace ‘ s–which we’re already on record liking a whole lot more than Curb ‘ s reboot–only major nominations were Megan Mullally’s supporting actress and Molly Shannon’s guest actress mentions. Good-for-nothing for the remainder of the Emmy-winning cast or Best Comedy. Twin Peaks didn’t fare much better, but both trumped Arrested Development , which came up completely empty.

SNUB/ SURPRISE: Speaking of improvements … Roseanne

The most talked-about reveal on Tv this past time didn’t carry polemic into a Best Comedy gesture, which is both unsurprising and maybe also totally scandalizing, depending on how cynical you are. Roseanne Barr didn’t take the whole ship down with her, though. Laurie Metcalf is nominated for Best Substantiating Actress–much deserved–though we’d have loved John Goodman and Sara Gilbert to have gotten more serious consideration, too.

SURPRISE: Jason Bateman dominates drama , not comedy

In the wake of the one of the most egregious mansplaining calamities recorded for public uptake, Jason Bateman’s joins Arrested Development ‘ s complete Emmy shut out. But we’d enterprise he’s hardly disturbed, what with receiving Best Drama Actor and Best Drama Directing nominations for his work on Netflix’s Ozark . Noted dramatic performer, Jason Bateman.

SURPRISE/ SNUB: Jessica Biel! And the utter nonsense of the Limited Series categories

Ladies and gentlemen, Emmy nominee Jessica Biel! Truthfully, the snark is totally unfounded, for Biel’s work on The Sinner is one of the only performances that belongs in the otherwise entirely random Best Limited Series or Movie Actress category, amid total nonsense rosters for the entire genre.

Good the job is rewarded–Laura Dern and The Tale , Benedict Cumberbatch and Patrick Melrose , Jesse Plemons and Black Mirror — but the rest is a grab bag. The Assassination of Gianni Versace deserve to be rained with adore, but we’d have limited the acting nods to Darren Criss, Judith Light, and Penelope Cruz. But the odd quantity of love for The Alienist , Genius: Picasso , and American Horror Story: Cult is laughable when Alias Grace , Howard’s End , and American Vandal em> all could have been nominated instead.

Last year, Bill Maher’s HBO talk series payed a nomination despite a overflow of bad press over his use of the N-word. So it’s a little shocking to discover him passed over this year, after being nominated in Outstanding Variety Series every year from 2005 through 2014 and Outstanding Variety Talk Series in 2016 and 2017.

After 15 years on Saturday Night Live , a long time tenure of any current casting member, Kenan Thompson gets his much overdue first Emmy acting nomination, joining last year’s nominees Alec Baldwin, Kate McKinnon, and Leslie Jones, and, in another delightful amaze, Aidy Bryant, too, who also scored her much deserved first acting gesture.( Fun fact: Both Thompson and Bryant have been nominated for one Emmy each before, for writing original anthems for SNL .)

SNUB: Jon Snow and Aunt Khaleesi

While Game of Thrones predominated the nominations, including behaving nods for Lena Headey, Peter Dinklage, and first-time nominee Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, both Kit Harington and Emilia Clarke were snubbed after moving up into the Lead Actor and Actress races. Once mocked as maybe the worst see on television and the case study for why reboot culture is bad for art and recreation, Fuller House is now an Emmy nominee, something its predecessor never managed to accomplish. The Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling muscled their way into a competitive Outstanding Comedy Series category, which had to expand to eight nominees to accommodate all the programs. tags: a song of ice and fire
title: 2018 sign-ups are OPEN!
body:
hey everyone! :D

first:

THE SIGN-UP FORM IS HERE :)

anyone who wants to participate, please feel free to head there. it’s open from today july 20th to july 27th so you have an entire week to sign up. :)

now, how it works:

  • after you sign up, you will receive an e-mail your assignment. as in, you won’t know you’re creating from, you will just get the prompts. if you need to ask your recipient any question hand them over to me and I’ll make sure they get it and give you back the answer. after then, you will have to choose one prompt to fill and you will have about one month and a half to do it. to fulfill your assignment you need to do one gift only, then if you want to fill more prompts or merge them it’s fine but that’s entirely optional.
  • since from what I gather there’s an even number of fanfic writers/fanartists and someone would do fanvids and someone else fanmixes, in order to try to make everyone happy you will have to write at least one thing you can do in the sign-up form (as in, I can write fanfic/I can do fanart, if you can do both and don’t mind just list both) and then list three you might like to receive. as in, I can only write fanfic and I’d like to receive either a fanfic, a fanart or a fanvid. at that point I will need three prompts for each.

Example just to be extra clear (the form has of course have preferences for ships and so on, this is just for the prompts formatting; you can choose any ship or relationship as long as theon’s a part of it).

username name: janiedean (tumblr)/janie-tangerine on ao3
what I can do: fanfic, fanmixes
what I would love to receive: fanfic, fanart, fanvideo

  • three fanfic prompts: 1) classic bodyswap canon au where theon and robb switch bodies at any point before the red wedding, 2) theon becomes stannis’ hostage rather than ned’s: how does it go, 3) show canon fix it fic where his relationship with sansa is written believably.
  • three fanart prompts: 1) theon and asha ten years after the long night is over, 2) theon/robb cosplaying as han solo and leia from star wars, your choice re who is han solo and who’s leia, 3) jon + robb/theon star wars au with the three of them as rey, poe and finn respectively
  • three fanvid prompts: 1) theon gen video set to warren zevon’s accidentally like a martyr, 2) happy-ish au theon/robb video with a song of your choice, 3) sad af canon theon/robb video set to the horrible crowes’ black betty and the moon.

this is so that I can match everyone up to their best capacities and I don’t end up giving all fanart to fanartists, the videos to the vidders and the fanfic to the writers and so on. (if you want a fanmix I guess the prompt could be something like ‘hey can I have a theon country fanmix’ or something like that XD). also, I will post a more thorough rules post later, but just in case:

  • anyone can participate. I don’t care if you’ve been in the fandom for ten years or if you just arrived and you still haven’t interacted with anyone else or posted any content. you can participate whoever the hell you are, as long as you want to play then who am I to say no.
  • you don’t need to have a tumblr. anon submitting/asking is allowed, so if you aren’t on tumblr we can work out the details later - as long as you give me an email you’re good. if you’re on another site ie ao3/lj/dw just post your gift there and we’ll link it through submission, if you don’t have either but want to participate we can work anything out as long as I have an email.

also, last thing: PLEASE FILL ALL THE BOXES FOR A) THE THREE TYPES OF FANWORK YOU WANNA RECEIVE, B) THE THREE PROMPTS FOR EVERY TYPE. guys I mean it more than one person last year put ‘idk’ instead of the three prompts or the types and I cannot match people properly if you give me just one. like, really, please make my life easy XD

… that’s it, you can go ahead ;)

also, last thing: PLEASE FILL ALL THE BOXES FOR A) THE THREE TYPES OF FANWORK YOU WANNA RECEIVE, B) THE THREE PROMPTS FOR EVERY TYPE. guys I mean it more than one person last year put ‘idk’ instead of the three prompts or the types and I cannot match people properly if you give me just one. like, really, please make my life easy XD

… that’s it, you can go ahead ;)
trail.content:
hey everyone! :D

first:

THE SIGN-UP FORM IS HERE :)

anyone who wants to participate, please feel free to head there. it’s open from today july 20th to july 27th so you have an entire week to sign up. :)

now, how it works:

  • after you sign up, you will receive an e-mail your assignment. as in, you won’t know you’re creating from, you will just get the prompts. if you need to ask your recipient any question hand them over to me and I’ll make sure they get it and give you back the answer. after then, you will have to choose one prompt to fill and you will have about one month and a half to do it. to fulfill your assignment you need to do one gift only, then if you want to fill more prompts or merge them it’s fine but that’s entirely optional.
  • since from what I gather there’s an even number of fanfic writers/fanartists and someone would do fanvids and someone else fanmixes, in order to try to make everyone happy you will have to write at least one thing you can do in the sign-up form (as in, I can write fanfic/I can do fanart, if you can do both and don’t mind just list both) and then list three you might like to receive. as in, I can only write fanfic and I’d like to receive either a fanfic, a fanart or a fanvid. at that point I will need three prompts for each.

Example just to be extra clear (the form has of course have preferences for ships and so on, this is just for the prompts formatting; you can choose any ship or relationship as long as theon’s a part of it).

username name: janiedean (tumblr)/janie-tangerine on ao3
what I can do: fanfic, fanmixes
what I would love to receive: fanfic, fanart, fanvideo

  • three fanfic prompts: 1) classic bodyswap canon au where theon and robb switch bodies at any point before the red wedding, 2) theon becomes stannis’ hostage rather than ned’s: how does it go, 3) show canon fix it fic where his relationship with sansa is written believably.
  • three fanart prompts: 1) theon and asha ten years after the long night is over, 2) theon/robb cosplaying as han solo and leia from star wars, your choice re who is han solo and who’s leia, 3) jon + robb/theon star wars au with the three of them as rey, poe and finn respectively
  • three fanvid prompts: 1) theon gen video set to warren zevon’s accidentally like a martyr, 2) happy-ish au theon/robb video with a song of your choice, 3) sad af canon theon/robb video set to the horrible crowes’ black betty and the moon.

this is so that I can match everyone up to their best capacities and I don’t end up giving all fanart to fanartists, the videos to the vidders and the fanfic to the writers and so on. (if you want a fanmix I guess the prompt could be something like ‘hey can I have a theon country fanmix’ or something like that XD). also, I will post a more thorough rules post later, but just in case:

  • anyone can participate. I don’t care if you’ve been in the fandom for ten years or if you just arrived and you still haven’t interacted with anyone else or posted any content. you can participate whoever the hell you are, as long as you want to play then who am I to say no.
  • you don’t need to have a tumblr. anon submitting/asking is allowed, so if you aren’t on tumblr we can work out the details later - as long as you give me an email you’re good. if you’re on another site ie ao3/lj/dw just post your gift there and we’ll link it through submission, if you don’t have either but want to participate we can work anything out as long as I have an email.

also, last thing: PLEASE FILL ALL THE BOXES FOR A) THE THREE TYPES OF FANWORK YOU WANNA RECEIVE, B) THE THREE PROMPTS FOR EVERY TYPE. guys I mean it more than one person last year put ‘idk’ instead of the three prompts or the types and I cannot match people properly if you give me just one. like, really, please make my life easy XD

… that’s it, you can go ahead ;)

summary: 19 Hilarious Overheard Conversation That Will Absolutely Slay You
title: 19 Hilarious Overheard Conversation That Will Absolutely Slay You
body:
It’s not nice to eavesdrop.

But if you happen to overhear a hilarious conversation, well… that’s entirely different.

Advertisement

Overheard conversations are the best because you have no context at all for what’s being said.

Most of the time, you’re hearing only a portion of the conversation, which means it usually makes so sense.

These 19 overheard conversations are super funny for precisely that reason.

Advertisement

Eat cake and be sassy

via: Twitter

I actually think that was Marie Antoinette’s full quote: “Let them eat cake and be sassy.”

She just wanted everyone to be happy.

Advertisement

It was amazing

via: Twitter

Don’t you just love when you think two women are talking about sexytimes but they’re actually flipping out over a gooey, cheesy pizza?!

Advertisement

Overheard at Target

via: Twitter

What a cute, supportive couple.

If you’ve ever stepped foot in a Target, you know how hard it is to stay out of the clothes section.

Advertisement

Zombies

via: Twitter

Ugh, this is so true though. Maybe I’d get really fit f I were a zombie, though.

The next one is adorably scary.

Advertisement

Subscribe!

via: Twitter

In case you were wondering if little kids are affected by Youtube culture.

I present this mess!

Advertisement

Marry yourself

via: Twitter

Yasss, girl, get it!

This is the kind of self-love we should be promoting in young girls from the time they are young!

Advertisement

Dad’s gonna FREAK

via: Twitter

This little girl knows what’s up.

Quick, go home and hide this stuff all over the house.

Advertisement

Incredibles 2

via: Twitter

This is amazing.

You get it, mom.

Advertisement

Licked a toad

via: Twitter

There is nothing you can say to make this person understand what happened. You just have to go deal with it.

The next one is also absurd.

Advertisement

Overheard at camp

via: Twitter

Whoa. Dramatic.

Camp is the place where real friendship sh*t goes down.

Advertisement

The aliens

via: Twitter

You know, they made that documentary about it.

It’s called Independence Day, and it’s definitely a documentary.

Advertisement

Game of Thrones

via: Twitter

Fingers crossed!

Man, they really do make us wait for ages for those episodes.

Advertisement

Ice Juice

via: Twitter

I think “Ice juice” is the most upsetting phrase I’ve ever heard in my entire life.

It makes the hair on the back of my neck stand up.

Advertisement

Jedi training

via: Twitter

Jedi training at Disney World is serious business.

The next one is hilarious because it’s between two little kids.

Advertisement

Bring it down

via: Twitter

The fact that a seven-year-old is saying this to a five-year-old just makes it all the more hilarious.

Advertisement

Peanut Butter and Genocide

via: Twitter

Wow, this person must have been in two very different moods while naming their dogs.

Or maybe the dogs have very different dispositions.

Advertisement

Little league

via: Twitter

Little league games can be so intense, and if you’ve never lived through one, you haven’t known stress.

Sincerely,

Someone who grew up in a baseball/softball family.

Advertisement

Tater tots

via: Twitter

If I heard this out in public, I don’t know if I would be able to resist contributing a hearty, “Hear! Hear!”

Hashbrowns are better than tater tots. Full stop.

Advertisement

Legalized weed

via: Twitter

Dude, I do not blame them one bit.

Share this with someone who always eavesdrops on conversations!

Advertisement

Read more: http://twentytwowords.com/hilarious-overheard-conversation-that-will-absolutely-slay-you/
